meanings.definition: To make something more rad or cool.
meanings.sent1: She radded up her skateboard with colorful stickers.
meanings.sent2: He radded his outfit with a stylish hat.
meanings.sent3: The party was already cool, but she radded it up with a DJ.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude radded up the whole team.
meanings.sent5: Adding fairy lights radded up the room for the party.

meanings.definition: Past tense of the verb 'rad', meaning to be excellent or impressive.
meanings.sent1: They radded their performance at the talent show last night.
meanings.sent2: The new video game they released really radded up the gaming community.
meanings.sent3: The cake was already delicious, but the frosting radded it up even more.
meanings.sent4: Her smile radded up the entire photograph.
meanings.sent5: The sunset radded up the view from the hilltop.
